Explore a different side of the bustling metropolis of Kuala Lumpur with a visit to Putrajaya and Agriculture Heritage Park Enjoy an informative and relaxing half day trip and discover Kuala Lumpur's calmer side in Putrajaya, 25km south of the capital Embark on a guided tour of the Agriculture Heritage Park to learn more about local farming and produce Discover more about Malaysia's signature fruits: mango, cocoa, durian, jackfruit and more Discover unique local architecture at Putra Jaya Government Centre and Putra Mosque Enjoy an informative and relaxing half day trip and discover Kuala Lumpur's calmer side in Putrajaya, 25km south of the capital Embark on a guided tour of the Agriculture Heritage Park to learn more about local farming and produce Discover more about Malaysia's signature fruits: mango, cocoa, durian, jackfruit and more Discover unique local architecture at Putra Jaya Government Centre and Putra Mosque What We Love:   What We Love: Discover Malaysia's natural treasures on the Putrajaya and Agriculture Heritage Park Tour. Located in Precinct 16, Putrajaya, the Agricultural Heritage Park offers an insight into the historical and commercial background of Malaysia's farming and artisan crafts. Here, you can sample fresh seasonal fruits and watch demonstrations of rubber tapping, latex collection, crop maintenance, fruits preservation and others. Continue the tour with a visit to Putra Jaya Government Centre and don't miss out on exploring the iconic Putra Mosque in detail. Incorporating a mix of architectural elements from Turkestan, Kazakhstan and Morocco, it's a true sight to admire.

strIntroduction: Relax and unwind in the calm, quiet and authentic fishermen's island Pulau Ketam Leave the busy city behind and journey to the slow-paced island of a traditional crab village Discover this rare and traditional fishing village, part of a small cluster of islands on the coast to the east of KL Get snap happy with Crab Island's iconic 'floating houses', perched above sea level Indulge in a delicious lunch of the village's famed local seafood Leave the busy city behind and journey to the slow-paced island of a traditional crab village Discover this rare and traditional fishing village, part of a small cluster of islands on the coast to the east of KL Get snap happy with Crab Island's iconic 'floating houses', perched above sea level Indulge in a delicious lunch of the village's famed local seafood What We Love:   What We Love: Pulau Ketam, a small island located off the coast of Klang, has earned itself the nickname of "Crab Island". Home to a large fishermen community, the island's signature symbols are its "floating houses", perched on wooden stilts above sea level. The island is the perfect place to leave the city's hustle and bustle behind and truly experience the lifestyle of a fisherman. No air pollution, no traffic jams, no crowds or queues - the ultimate escape. With an abundance of fresh seafood, the island offers a wide range of seafood dining options.

Discover Chinese culture in Vietnam with this guided tour of Ho Chi Minh's Chinatown by 'cyclo' Be guided by an English speaking guide and one of Saigon's experts Learn about the history and day to day life of one of the world's oldest Chinatowns Enjoy a special masterclass in traditional cooking onboard Lady Hau rice barge before tucking into the feast you prepared Be guided by an English speaking guide and one of Saigon's experts Learn about the history and day to day life of one of the world's oldest Chinatowns Enjoy a special masterclass in traditional cooking onboard Lady Hau rice barge before tucking into the feast you prepared What We Love:   What We Love: You've all heard of Chinatown but have you seen it Vietnamese-style? Head to one the world's oldest Chinatowns and see, hear and taste the soul of Cho Lon. You'll tour the town the traditional way by being chauffeured on a cyclo (a three-wheeled bicycle taxi). Stopping along the way you'll be immersed in Chinese culture with a visit to Bihn Tay Market, filled with quintessential Chinese artifacts like calligraphy artwork, paper lanterns and traditional medicine. Foodies will also be able to enjoy this tour with stops in the fruit markets to try exotic fruits and a pitstop for Vietnam's famous coffee. Before the tour ends, you will board a restored traditional rice barge to enjoy lunch and a master class in cooking authentic Vietnamese cuisine.

Experience the Vietnamese spectacular that is A O Show, a beautiful lyrical performance of stories from the people of Vietnam Be guided to the Saigon Opera House and enjoy one of Ho Chi Minh's most well known shows After the show, experience Vietnamese cuisine in one of the city's contemporary restaurants Enjoy the ease of private hotel pick up and drop off included Be guided to the Saigon Opera House and enjoy one of Ho Chi Minh's most well known shows After the show, experience Vietnamese cuisine in one of the city's contemporary restaurants Enjoy the ease of private hotel pick up and drop off included What We Love:   What We Love: The A O Show is an unmissable performance held in the beautiful Saigon Opera House. Join in the playful narrative, telling the tale of the people of Vietnam. The show is a lively performance featuring some of the best musicians, performing artists and acrobats in the country. Everything has been expertly designed right down to the props, crafted to recreate realistic scenes of the countryside, the hustle and bustle of the big cities and the waves that hit Vietnam's coast. Back to the real world, once the show is over you'll make your way through central Ho Chi Minh to Hoa Tuc Restaurant where you will be sitting down for dinner. Situated in an old French colonial building the restaurant serves up contemporary Vietnamese cuisine - a perfect way to end a night full of fun!

Ever wondered about Saigon? Take yourself back a century and learn how Ho Chi Minh City came to be Visit a number of Saigon's historic religlious relics Enjoy the tour on foot and on a cyclo (three-wheeled bike)! Get an insight into local life in Nguyen Trung To Street learning about traditional wedding rituals Visit a number of Saigon's historic religlious relics Enjoy the tour on foot and on a cyclo (three-wheeled bike)! Get an insight into local life in Nguyen Trung To Street learning about traditional wedding rituals What We Love:   What We Love: Meeting at your hotel, your tour guide will then take you into the center of old Saigon, now known as Ho Chi Minh. Marvel at the ornate building facades famed for their neo-Romanesque style - evidence of the French influence on Vietnam. Moving on, you'll head along the Saigon River ending up at the Opera House, a significant spot during the Second World War. The tour continues on to Reunification Palace where North Vietnamese Army tanks ended the war in 1975. Travel in time through this fascinating city from significant eras of history to the present day with your informative private guide.

Cruise the Saigon River as you make your way to the famous Cu Chi Tunnels, a stronghold of the Viet Cong during the Vietnam War Observe the quaint 'weekend' homes of local Saigonese inhabitants as you cruise along the Saigon River Descend into the famous Cu Chi tunnels to discover what life was really like for Vietnamese soldiers during the war Visit a cricket farm and sample this unique local delicacy A traditional Vietnamese-style lunch plus hotel transfers are included in the price Observe the quaint 'weekend' homes of local Saigonese inhabitants as you cruise along the Saigon River Descend into the famous Cu Chi tunnels to discover what life was really like for Vietnamese soldiers during the war Visit a cricket farm and sample this unique local delicacy A traditional Vietnamese-style lunch plus hotel transfers are included in the price What We Love:   What We Love: Immerse yourself in Vietnamese history and culture on this eye-opening tour of the famous Cu Chi Tunnels. Avoid the traffic and cruise your way down the Saigon River by luxury speedboat, from which you'll be able to observe daily river life and the many picturesque 'weekend' homes that now line the river bank. When you arrive your enthusiastic guide will help to bring the war to life by walking you through the tactics that were used by these ruthless fighters. If you're feeling brave enough, descend into the cramped tunnels for a taste of what life was like a guerilla soldier on the front line. Once your tour is over, you'll be taken through the beautiful countryside to a local cricket farm. Many Vietnamese consider crickets a delicacy, and you'll have the opportunity to try these unique treats (only if you fancy it!). Tuck in to a tasty traditional lunch to top off this culturally rich day.

Enjoy a leisurely sightseeing cruise along the busy waterways of Mekong Delta. Stop for a local lunch at a beautiful colonial restaurant to get a glimpse of Indochinese life Enjoy being pampered by the wonderfully helpful staff on board the Cai Be Princess sampan Observe local life and the beautiful natural surroundings from the comfort of your boat Enjoy a lunch of delicious local delicacies A personal vehicle will transfer you back to your hotel Enjoy being pampered by the wonderfully helpful staff on board the Cai Be Princess sampan Observe local life and the beautiful natural surroundings from the comfort of your boat Enjoy a lunch of delicious local delicacies A personal vehicle will transfer you back to your hotel What We Love:   What We Love: Watch the wonders of local life pass you by as you spend a day leisurely cruising the waterways of the Mekong Delta. Board the stunning Cai Be Princess sampan to enjoy a day of pampering and quality sightseeing. The attentive staff will ensure that your experience is blissful from start to finish - providing you with cold towels, refreshing drinks, tea and fresh fruit. The crew will regularly stop en route to show you glimpses of local industries at work, and you'll get to watch coconut candy and puffed rice (Vietnamese popcorn!) be made by hand. Your river cruise will end at the stunning Le Longanier Restaurant - set in a colonial building in a tranquil tropical garden. Savor your taste of life in Indochinese times as you tuck into a tasty lunch of local specialities, before taking a stroll along the canal nearby. A day in local paradise!

Travel into the Mekong Delta and explore the waterways that make up this fascinating location. Enjoy a tasty three-course lunch of Mekong delicacies on board the beautiful teak boat Le Jarai Tour the canals and waterways of the Mekong Delta, and visit a brick factory and a homemade coconut processing plant Watch mat weavers at work as you wander around a small local village Board Le Jarai, the beautiful teak boat, for a river cruise Join in a cooking demonstration and tuck in to a delicious three-course lunch Tours and tranfers are included in the price Tour the canals and waterways of the Mekong Delta, and visit a brick factory and a homemade coconut processing plant Watch mat weavers at work as you wander around a small local village Board Le Jarai, the beautiful teak boat, for a river cruise Join in a cooking demonstration and tuck in to a delicious three-course lunch Tours and tranfers are included in the price What We Love:   What We Love: Spend a day getting lost in the wonderful waterways of the Mekong Delta - also known as the 'rice bowl' of Vietnam for it's large rice production. Start your sightseeing adventure with a small boat trip for an intimate glimpse at local life. You'll be taken to a brick factory and a small homemade coconut processing plant, where you'll learn how oil, candy and mats are made for the local markets. Take a short stroll to a nearby village for a fascinating peek at mat weavers at other local merchants at their work, before boarding the beautiful teak boat Le Jarai. As you cruise the crisp waters, you'll have the opportunity to take part in a lively cooking demonstration, before indulging in a delicious three-course lunch of local delicacies. Head up to the top deck after lunch for a relaxing cruise back to land, and savor the view of the stunning scenery around you before you head home.
strTitle: Le Jarai Mekong Cruise & Full Day Tour

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly What is it like to fight, work, eat and sleep underground? Answer these questions and more on a guided tour of Vietnam's Cu Chi tunnels Discover the hidden underground world of Vietnam's complicated network of tunnels Learn about the complicated and incredibly inventive lives of the tunnel residents Pay a visit to a local family to learn about Vietnam's history and culture first hand Gain insight into the life in the area in both past and present Discover the hidden underground world of Vietnam's complicated network of tunnels Learn about the complicated and incredibly inventive lives of the tunnel residents Pay a visit to a local family to learn about Vietnam's history and culture first hand Gain insight into the life in the area in both past and present What We Love:   What We Love: Attend the most exciting history lesson ever! Learn about Vietnam's guerilla war by climbing into the underground tunnels that played a crucial part in the fight. Built by local fighters during the Indochina conflict, the Cu Chi tunnels served as base for Viet Cong, the National Liberation Front, where the local soldiers and residents used to eat, sleep, work, cook and even go to school. Started in 1948 as a hiding place from French air attacks, by 1965 the tunnel was estimated to consist of an astounding 200 km of tunnels. It included almost everything needed for the life of local inhabitants: hospitals, schools, meeting rooms, kitchens and more. You will get to see and explore it all on the Cu Chi Tunnels tour.

Embark on your perfect evening in Hanoi with a water puppetry show, delicious Hanoian meal and a taste of Vietnamese cafe culture led by an informative guide Experience Hanoi's Water Puppetry Show, famed in Vietnam Tuck into a meal and try some of Hanoi's specialities Take the chance to get a local insight into Vietnamese culture from your Hanoi native guide End the evening with a special Vietnamese coffee (the unique flavor of 'egg coffee' is a particular treat!) Experience Hanoi's Water Puppetry Show, famed in Vietnam Tuck into a meal and try some of Hanoi's specialities Take the chance to get a local insight into Vietnamese culture from your Hanoi native guide End the evening with a special Vietnamese coffee (the unique flavor of 'egg coffee' is a particular treat!) What We Love:   What We Love: Plan a perfect night out in Hanoi with this special guided tour. Start the night by watching Hanoi's famed Water Puppet Show, an impressive showcase originating from Northern Vietnamese villages in the 11th century. The show incorporates puppets, music and dance mimicking the traditional folk tales of Vietnam. Once the show ends, tuck into an authentic Hanoian dinner at a Cha Ca restaurant. This restaurant is known for serving the 200-year-old Vietnamese specialty dish infusing white fish in saffron oils, served with a variety of greens and washed down with a glass of Bia Ha Noi, the local brew. Complete your evening in one of the many street cozy side cafes with a cup of the famous Vietnamese coffee in hand.

Take a private guided tour of Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, the Presidential Palace and Hanoi's Old Quarter by cyclo Visit the sacred site of Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum Be guided around the mausoleum grounds learning about the history of the revolution from your private guide Roam past the iconic yellow Presidential Palace and visit the humble home of Ho Chi Minh Visit the Temple of Literature, the first university of Vietnam, featured on the 100.000 VND bank note! Hop onboard a cyclo to tour the streets of Hanoi's Old Quarter Visit the sacred site of Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum Be guided around the mausoleum grounds learning about the history of the revolution from your private guide Roam past the iconic yellow Presidential Palace and visit the humble home of Ho Chi Minh Visit the Temple of Literature, the first university of Vietnam, featured on the 100.000 VND bank note! Hop onboard a cyclo to tour the streets of Hanoi's Old Quarter What We Love:   What We Love: Get a detailed overview of Hanoi's history and sightsee some of the most famous sights. In this tour of Hanoi your experienced tour guide will take you to some of the most historically significant places whilst relating some of the turbulent history of Vietnam. Start the day at Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum to recount the leader's movement for independence from French colonial rule. Ho Chi Minh's body was preserved after his death in 1969 and continues to be visited by thousands of people every year. Afterward, take the chance to stroll through the Presidential Palace grounds and see the one pillar pagoda temple. The Temple of Literature is well worth a stop, this beautiful 11th Century temple is dedicated to Confucious. Next you'll hop on a cyclo and breeze through the Old Quarter learning about daily Hanoi life and the 36 streets selling local wares.

Explore the historical Hanoi on this walking and cyclo tour of notable temples, churches, colonial houses, markets and desserts! Ride by French colonial houses on a 'cyclo' rickshaw Visit an ancient citadel, a Catholic church and a Taoist temple Snack on Vietnamese dishes and taste test wedding cake Experience the flurry of a Hanoi market then relax with a Vietnamese coffee Ride by French colonial houses on a 'cyclo' rickshaw Visit an ancient citadel, a Catholic church and a Taoist temple Snack on Vietnamese dishes and taste test wedding cake Experience the flurry of a Hanoi market then relax with a Vietnamese coffee What We Love:   What We Love: Explore the historical parts of Hanoi by foot and by cyclo. Start the tour by hopping aboard a cyclo, a traditional rickshaw, and begin the afternoon traveling through the bustling old quarter, along streets lined with French colonial houses. Once you've reached the Northern Gate of the ancient citadel discover the beautiful Cua Bac Church - a notable example of Catholic influence in the city. You'll then move onto Quan Thanh Temple one of the oldest Taoist temples before heading towards West Lake, hearing the story of John McCain as a Vietnamese Prisoner of War as you stroll. Make a pitstop at Pho Cuon Restaurant for a bite to eat before heading to Chau Long market to get a feel for local life including a walk through a famous dessert street and a wedding cake street (you'll even get to sample a few!) Shake off the sugar rush at Hang Ga Street, the mat weaving borough, then end the tour with a famous Vietnamese coffee at one the many streetside cafes.

Hit the streets of Hanoi in a guided food tour that's guaranteed to make your mouth water Discover the backstreets and local markets in the Old Quarter of Hanoi Visit Hanoi's best street food spots guided by your resident foodie and Hanoi expert Say cheers with one of Hanoi's local brews Try some of the best savory dishes and finish the night with a local dessert Discover the backstreets and local markets in the Old Quarter of Hanoi Visit Hanoi's best street food spots guided by your resident foodie and Hanoi expert Say cheers with one of Hanoi's local brews Try some of the best savory dishes and finish the night with a local dessert What We Love:   What We Love: This street food tour will give you the best introduction to traditional Hanoi fare whilst exploring the bustling Old Quarter. Enjoy a glass of the local brew at the Bia Hoi corner - a beverage with eastern European roots. Continue on down the streets trying out noodles, breads and other tasty snacks. Sit down at one of the pop-up restaurants and treat yourself to some famous Vietnamese grilled skewers. Make sure to save space for the last stop at one of Hanoi's most well known ice cream parlours. The tour is tailored to what's fresh that season and which vendors are open that day, so come with an open mind and an empty belly!

Delve into the past and present of Vietnam's capital to get an excellent overview of the history and culture of Hanoi on this full day private tour Take a tour of Hanoi's past with your English speaking guide Visit Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, the Temple of Literature and the imperial citadel Savor a delicious traditional Vietnamese lunch Enjoy a 30 minute cyclo tour through the vibrant Old Quarter Sip on a famous cup of Vietnamese coffee while you take in the view of Hoan Kiem Lake Take a tour of Hanoi's past with your English speaking guide Visit Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum, the Temple of Literature and the imperial citadel Savor a delicious traditional Vietnamese lunch Enjoy a 30 minute cyclo tour through the vibrant Old Quarter Sip on a famous cup of Vietnamese coffee while you take in the view of Hoan Kiem Lake What We Love:   What We Love: Explore the formative years of Hanoi including the days under French colonial rule and Ho Chi Minh's campaign for independence beginning with a visit to Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum. Next, visit the imperial citadel, the apex of regional political power for more than a millennium which is still being excavated. Enjoy a traditional Vietnamese lunch before visiting the Temple of Literature, a relic from the 11th century built as an homage to Confucius, the Chinese scholar and philosopher. See the iconic Long Bien Bridge, a relic of French colonial rule crossing the Red River. Ride a cyclo and stroll past the heart of Hanoi, the beautiful Old Quarter, a collection of 36 narrow streets that were named for the products sold from their shops - Bamboo and Tin Streets still sell the same wares as they did years before! Get your caffeine fix at the end of the tour with a strong dose of Vietnamese coffee then round off the day with a picture taken with the beautiful downtown skyline as a background.
strTitle: Story of Hanoi Private Day Tour

strIntroduction: Discover the ancient artistic trades of Vietnam in villages know for ceramic and silk production on this full day tour from Hanoi led by a private guide Watch as ceramics are made before your eyes and learn about a family tradition that is centuries old Visit a 17th century pagoda - one of the most picturesque landmarks in the area Witness the making of delicate silk creations in Van Phuc Village Enjoy a local lunch included on the tour Hotel transfers and a local English speaking guide are included in the private tour Watch as ceramics are made before your eyes and learn about a family tradition that is centuries old Visit a 17th century pagoda - one of the most picturesque landmarks in the area Witness the making of delicate silk creations in Van Phuc Village Enjoy a local lunch included on the tour Hotel transfers and a local English speaking guide are included in the private tour What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a tour through centuries of cultural history as you discover the wonderful ancient crafts of Vietnam. Your first stop will be the quaint village of Bat Trang, where families have been producing ceramics by hand for over 400 years! You'll not only get to witness the creation process first hand; your enthusiastic local guide will also tell you all about the history of this century old trade as you watch. From there you'll be taken to see the But Thap Pagoda - one of the most stunning sites in the area situated along the picturesque Duong River. Replenish with a delicious local lunch before heading to Van Phuc Village, the most famous silk village in all of Vietnam. Prepare to be mesmerised as you stroll through the scenic streets of this unique town - you'll even have the chance to purchase some of the wonderful creations made here on your way through. For art lovers and culture admirers alike, it's a wonderful insight into Vietnam's rich handicraft history.

A day of trekking, walking and cycling at the spectacular Ba Vi Mountain and ancient Duong Lam Village Visit the highlights in the west of Hanoi with an English speaking private guide Marvel at the wonderful views of the Ba Vi Mountain and Da River Enjoy lunch with local residents of Duong Lam Village Ride around this national heritage area by bicycle Visit the highlights in the west of Hanoi with an English speaking private guide Marvel at the wonderful views of the Ba Vi Mountain and Da River Enjoy lunch with local residents of Duong Lam Village Ride around this national heritage area by bicycle What We Love:   What We Love: Begin your day of exploration with a two hour ride to the west of Hanoi and take in the marvellous Ba Vi Mountain along the way and the terraced landscapes where locals grow crops. Burn off calories with a short trek through the cloud forest and enjoy the great view of the Da River. You will then descent to the Duong Lam Village, where some of the buildings are over a hundred years old. Get the unique chance to communicate with villagers as you eat your lunch at a local home. The adventurous day ends with the leisurely bicycle ride around the village's winding alleyways.
strTitle: Ba Vi & Duong Lam Private Tour

strIntroduction: Go back in time to the days of the Dinh and Le dynasties and explore the ruins of the ancient capital of Hoa Lu then enjoy a leisurely boat cruise before discovering the famous Three Caves Visit the spectacular ruins of the ancient capital of the Dinh and Le dynasties Enjoy a relaxing boat cruise to the marvellous Tam Coc (Three Caves) Glide past the area's incredible karst mountain scenery Tuck in to a tasty local lunch Transfers to and from your hotel plus your English speaking private guide are included Visit the spectacular ruins of the ancient capital of the Dinh and Le dynasties Enjoy a relaxing boat cruise to the marvellous Tam Coc (Three Caves) Glide past the area's incredible karst mountain scenery Tuck in to a tasty local lunch Transfers to and from your hotel plus your English speaking private guide are included What We Love:   What We Love: Delve into the past and discover the ancient capital of the Dinh and Le dynasties, renowned for extraordinary ruins that have survived a millenium. The surrounding scenery is absolutely breathtaking, so make sure you've got a camera to hand to capture the breathtaking scenes. Your enthusiastic local guide will show you some of Vietnam's most authentic cuisine for lunch, before you embark on a relaxing boat cruise. Prepare to be mesmerised as you paddle by the imposing Three Caves (Tam Coc) that dominate the area, and the limestone karst mountains that rise into the sky out of luminous rice fields and you'll see why Hoa Lu is also known as 'Halong Bay on land'. Your guide will handle all transfers and transport, so sit back and enjoy a relaxing day of sightseeing as you discover Vietnam's incredible natural beauty.

Explore Bac Ha and its vibrant weekly market on a day trip near Sapa Visit the region's busiest Sunday market - Sapa Bac Ha Watch villagers of every local ethnicity selling their produce, hailing from all corners of the countryside Visit the bizarre but beautiful palace built to entertain Hoang A Tuong Enjoy a traditional lunch at an authentic village and experience true local life Visit the region's busiest Sunday market - Sapa Bac Ha Watch villagers of every local ethnicity selling their produce, hailing from all corners of the countryside Visit the bizarre but beautiful palace built to entertain Hoang A Tuong Enjoy a traditional lunch at an authentic village and experience true local life What We Love:   What We Love: Head from Sapa to the usually sleepy town of Bac Ha which comes alive every Sunday as eager patrons descend on the Bac Ha Market, the largest in the region. Soak up the vibrant atmosphere and observe the mix of ethnic minority traders that make their weekly pilgrimage to the market from the surrounding mountainous areas. Browse the colourful stalls stocking a variety of local products, including brightly coloured handicrafts and fresh tea. Reach the northern edges of the town to visit Hoang A Tuong’s palace, or Vua Meo, a rather outlandish part exotic church, part French chateau hybrid, constructed by the French in 1921 in an unusual ‘oriental baroque’ style. Afterwards, wander the charming hamlet of Trung Do Village, the rustic home of the Tay ethnic minority group. Settle down for a tasty lunch prepared by a local Tay family and get a glimpse of village life. End the day with breathtaking views as you cruise down the Chay River by boat before heading back to Sapa Town.

The stunning beauty of Vietnam's countryside will unfold as you cycle through back roads and along the banks of the Red River. One of the highlights of the adventure is the stopover at a famous local artist's house where you will get to explore the trends in Vietnamese contemporary fine arts on a 2000 square meter estate.

Explore the famous Halong Bay, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and cruise through scenic spots at the Gulf of Tonkin Take in the stunning views of UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site --- Halong Bay Get ready for exotic photos and absorb the magnificent natural splendors, limestone bedrocks and sheer cliffs of tiny islands highlighted with fanciful names: Fighting Cocks (symbol of Halong Bay), Duck, Swan, Incense Burner, and Stone Dogs Explore a limestone cave with gorgeous stalactites and stalagmites and enjoy a fabulous seafood feast onboard Convenient hotel transfers, meals as stated and all admission fees are included Take in the stunning views of UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site --- Halong Bay Take in the stunning views of UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site --- Halong Bay Get ready for exotic photos and absorb the magnificent natural splendors, limestone bedrocks and sheer cliffs of tiny islands highlighted with fanciful names: Fighting Cocks (symbol of Halong Bay), Duck, Swan, Incense Burner, and Stone Dogs Get ready for exotic photos and absorb the magnificent natural splendors, limestone bedrocks and sheer cliffs of tiny islands highlighted with fanciful names: Fighting Cocks (symbol of Halong Bay), Duck, Swan, Incense Burner, and Stone Dogs Explore a limestone cave with gorgeous stalactites and stalagmites and enjoy a fabulous seafood feast onboard Explore a limestone cave with gorgeous stalactites and stalagmites and enjoy a fabulous seafood feast onboard Convenient hotel transfers, meals as stated and all admission fees are included Convenient hotel transfers, meals as stated and all admission fees are included What We Love:   What We Love: Halong Bay, located in the North East of Vietnam, is a remarkable site known for its crystal clear emerald waters and stunning limestone islands. Explore this unique location – which is a UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site – on a deluxe cruise with amazing food and mind blowing scenery. Visit Cua Von Floating village, go kayaking, stop by famous islands like Fighting Cocks and Stone Dogs, discover hidden private beaches and cool down with a relaxing swim. On board the cruise ship, an abundant feast awaits letting you recharge before embarking on another Halong Bay adventure.

Spend half a day on a private tour around the significant local highlights of Hoi An with an experienced tour guide Visit the Chua Ong Pagoda and Jinshang Temple, spiritual landmarks of the town Marvel at the symbol of Hoi An, the Japanese Covered Bridge, which is skillfully built with intricate patterns Explore traditional Hoi An architecture at the Tam Ky Ancient House with its back facing the river for the import and export of goods Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Visit the Chua Ong Pagoda and Jinshang Temple, spiritual landmarks of the town Marvel at the symbol of Hoi An, the Japanese Covered Bridge, which is skillfully built with intricate patterns Explore traditional Hoi An architecture at the Tam Ky Ancient House with its back facing the river for the import and export of goods Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Hoi An is a small but well-preserved former international trading port from the 15th to 18th century that welcomed Chinese, Dutch, French, Japanese, Portuguese and Arab merchants. Start your journey at the Chua Ong Pagoda - built in honor of the Chinese general Quan Cong, a symbol of courage and loyalty. Make an offering and the caretaker will strike a bronze bowl that makes a bell-like sound. Continue on to the Phuc Kien Assembly Hall where the Jinshang Temple is located. With Hoi An's history as a trading port, it is no surprise that the temple is dedicated to the goddess of the sea and protector of sailors. Finish the tour with the 200-year old ancestral house, Tam Ky, and a 17th century bridge built by Japanese craftsmen. The idyllic and relaxed vibe of the town makes it a great place to walk around on foot to take in its history.
strTitle: Hoi An Half Day Private Tour

strIntroduction: Explore the important historical landmarks of Hoi An on an afternoon stroll with an experienced guide Learn about the rich culture of Hoi An on a walking tour accompanied by your English speaking guide Visit the important landmarks of the town including the Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinshang Temple and Tan Ky House Unwind at the end of the day with a boat ride along the Thu Bon River, the ancient trading hub of Hoi An Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Learn about the rich culture of Hoi An on a walking tour accompanied by your English speaking guide Visit the important landmarks of the town including the Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinshang Temple and Tan Ky House Unwind at the end of the day with a boat ride along the Thu Bon River, the ancient trading hub of Hoi An Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Set out on foot to discover the hidden local gems of Hoi An in a day. Enjoy the laidback atmosphere making it the perfect setting for a stroll to take in the historical architecture. Begin your journey with the Chua Ong Pagoda, built in 1653 in honor of the Chinese general, Quan Cong, and still worshipped as a symbol of loyalty and justice today. Continue on your walk until you come across the Jinshang Temple and Tan Ky House, a 200 year old ancestral home, and a 17th century covered bridge built by Japanese craftsmen with a beautiful and intricate design. All the while, your English speaking guide will be relating an animated history of the sites you stroll past. End your journey with a relaxed boat trip along the Thu Bon River, which served as the central port of the ancient Champa dynasty.

Discover the local life of villagers and enjoy the beauty in the countryside on the outskirts of Hoi An Enjoy the charming scenery of Hoi An's countryside on a bicycle ride Meet a local family at Cam Thanh village and learn about their daily lives Ride on a bamboo basket boat and learn how to catch crabs Learn the art of lantern making at Ha Linh Enjoy the charming scenery of Hoi An's countryside on a bicycle ride Meet a local family at Cam Thanh village and learn about their daily lives Ride on a bamboo basket boat and learn how to catch crabs Learn the art of lantern making at Ha Linh What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy the breeze and picturesque scenery as you pedal your way around the Hoi An countryside. Immerse yourself in Vietnamese local life when your ride passes rows of tranquil rice paddy fields en route to Cam Thanh village – famous for its thatched roof cottages, which are woven from water coconut leaves. Converse with the local families living in the village and then try your hand at catching crabs onboard a bamboo basket boat learning from the expert knowledge of local fishermen. Take a short respite afterwards with a refreshing drink of fresh coconut water. Then continue with a cultural master class, learning how to create a beautiful lantern that you can take home as a souvenir of the day. Finally, continue enjoying the captivating landscape on the cycle back to Hoi An.

Discover the influential past of the ancient Cham kingdom on a private day tour to My Son Learn about the extensive history of the Champa kingdom from an experienced English speaking local guide Explore the ruins of what was once the religious and political hub of the Champa dynasty Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off (Hoi An town) Learn about the extensive history of the Champa kingdom from an experienced English speaking local guide Explore the ruins of what was once the religious and political hub of the Champa dynasty Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off (Hoi An town) What We Love:   What We Love: Depart the town of Hoi An to discover the most extensive ruins of the Champa dynasty in My Son, a kingdom of the 4th to 13th centuries. The impressive history of the Cham people stretches beyond Vietnam; their influence had spread to Laos and parts of Cambodia with My Son being the religious, political and cultural center of the kingdom. Only twenty structures of the ancient temples have survived the many years of decay and looting but coupled with the impressive lush jungle landscape, it remains a sight to behold. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the statues and decorative stonework that are visible show the remains of the impressive reign of the Cham monarchs.

Get out into the fields and learn how the local farming communities live. You'll be treated to an impressive cooking demonstration and lunch to end the morning Explore Tra Que village, where local communities have cultivated a large vegetable farm Learn traditional farming methods Watch an exciting cooking demonstration Local lunch and hotel transfers are included Explore Tra Que village, where local communities have cultivated a large vegetable farm Learn traditional farming methods Watch an exciting cooking demonstration Local lunch and hotel transfers are included What We Love:   What We Love: Embrace the local communities and spend a day discovering Vietnam's rural farming scene. Begin with a short bike ride past paddy fields and quant villages before coming to Tra Que village. The community here has cultivated an impressive vegetable farm and you'll have the chance to view all the different organic vegetables that are grown there. Local farmers will then teach you the traditional methods of planting, fertilising, and harvesting, before getting you to try out activities such as raking and sowing yourself! Wind down after a laborious morning with a relaxing herbal foot bath and massage. It's time to prove your cooking skills next, when you partake in a cooking demonstration with enthusiastic local chefs! A lunch of delicious home grown vegetables will be served shortly afterwards. This highly interactive tour is not one to miss if you're an outdoors enthusiast or simply want to learn more about Vietnam's rural culture!
strTitle: Hoi An Vegetable Village Private Tour

strIntroduction: Find out about the historical city of Hoi An in this tour that explores the most significant places of interest and local craft sites Visit many of Hoi An's top sightseeing spots in just one day See and learn about Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinsheng Temple, Tam Ky House and more Enjoy a relaxing cruise and visit a craft village near Hoi An Your enthusiastic local guide will offer you incredible insights into the history of this beautiful city Lunch and air conditioned hotel transfers are included Visit many of Hoi An's top sightseeing spots in just one day See and learn about Chua Ong Pagoda, Jinsheng Temple, Tam Ky House and more Enjoy a relaxing cruise and visit a craft village near Hoi An Your enthusiastic local guide will offer you incredible insights into the history of this beautiful city Lunch and air conditioned hotel transfers are included What We Love:   What We Love: Delve deep into Hoi An's history to learn how a 16th century port transformed into the quaint old quarter that exists today. Visit a number of the city's famous landmarks, starting with the Chua Ong Pagoda, built in 1653 to honor the Chinese general Quan Cong. Afterwards, you'll be whisked along to the majestic Jinshang Temple in the Phuc Kien Assembly Hall to witness the spiritual ambience of this marvellous landmark. Tam Ky House is next on the agenda - an ancient ancestral house famed for it's memorable yellow exterior. Make sure you've got a camera to hand when you walk over the 17th century Japanese bridge - a powerful symbol of Japan's fine craftsmanship. If you're starting to get tired after all this walking, sit back and relax on the boat cruise down to a craft village. You'll be able to watch traditional artisans make ceramics right before your eyes, before heading down to the docks to soak up scenes of local life on the water.
strTitle: Story of Hoi An Full Day Private Tour

strIntroduction: Discover the traditional techniques of the farmers and fishermen of Vietnam. Learn how to harvest and how to fling a fishing net during this truly cultural experience Witness Hoi An's wonderful natural beauty as you embrace the outdoor life of farmers and fishermen Get a real insight into local life during this highly interactive tour Opt for the additional bike ride or choose to take the shuttle bus instead Lunch and hotel transfers are included Witness Hoi An's wonderful natural beauty as you embrace the outdoor life of farmers and fishermen Get a real insight into local life during this highly interactive tour Opt for the additional bike ride or choose to take the shuttle bus instead Lunch and hotel transfers are included What We Love:   What We Love: Embrace the outdoors and experience a day in the life of a local farmer or fisherman! Witness some of Hoi An's most beautiful natural spots and get deep into the heart of Vietnamese culture. Start your day by cycling (or driving if you don't fancy the ride!) past luscious rice paddy fields on your way to Tra Que - famous for its scented greens. Once there, get out into the fields and learn the tricks of the trade from local experts. The area is known for producing some of Vietnam's best noodles and you'll even be treated to an intricate cooking demonstration from the farmers. Next up you'll be taking to the waters to try your hand at fishing - the traditional way. Don't underestimate the difficulty of throwing those huge nets - it's not a task for the faint hearted! Finish up your day by transfering to a "bucket boat" and try paddling in one of these unusually shaped vessels. This culturally enriching day is not to be missed if you want to learn more about Hoi An's rural heritage.
strTitle: Hoi An Farmer & Fisherman Group Tour

strIntroduction: Delve into the historical roots of Hue by visiting the former Imperial Palace and resting place of emperors on this half day private tour Learn about the former imperial capital of the Nguyen dynasty, Hue, from an experienced English speaking guide Visit two significant landmarks in Hue - the former Imperial Palace and Tu Duc Royal Tomb Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Learn about the former imperial capital of the Nguyen dynasty, Hue, from an experienced English speaking guide Visit two significant landmarks in Hue - the former Imperial Palace and Tu Duc Royal Tomb Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: Begin your half day historical tour with a trip to the ancient walled citadel containing the former Imperial Palace. Surrounded by protective ramparts and a ringed moat, within the citadel is the inner sanctum of the Imperial Palace, also known as the Purple Forbidden City - the architecture After that you'll take a short journey to the surrounding countryside to see the final resting place of former Nguyen emperors at the Tu Duc Royal Tomb. Completed before his death, the scholarly Emperor Tu Duc utilised it as a retreat complete with a lake, pavilion and theatre. Take a stroll along the complex and observe the artistic designs of the tomb and buildings.

Discover the regal past of Vietnam's old imperial capital, Hue, on this whole day tour Explore the former imperial capital of the Nguyen dynasty (1802-1945) with an experienced English speaking guide Visit two significant landmarks in Hue - the former Imperial Palace and Tu Duc Royal Tomb Enjoy a traditional Vietnamese lunch Hop aboard a boat ride on the Perfume River Explore the former imperial capital of the Nguyen dynasty (1802-1945) with an experienced English speaking guide Visit two significant landmarks in Hue - the former Imperial Palace and Tu Duc Royal Tomb Enjoy a traditional Vietnamese lunch Hop aboard a boat ride on the Perfume River What We Love:   What We Love: Start your day by visiting the former Imperial Palace, an important location for both Hue and Vietnam. Surrounded by protective ramparts and a ringed moat, within the citadel is the inner sanctum of the Imperial Palace, also known as the Purple Forbidden City - the architecture and design closely resembles Beijing's own Forbidden City. Next, take a short journey to the surrounding countryside to see the final resting place of former Nguyen emperor, Tu Duc, before jumping aboard a speed boat and letting the wind rustle your hair as you cruise down the world-renowned Perfume River.

History buffs, this one's for you. Explore significant battle sites and gain an in depth knowledge of the war between North and South on this full day private tour of the Vietnamese DMZ Let your experienced guide tell you the history of the Vietnam DMZ Explore Museums and important sites of the Vietnam war Dine on traditional Vietnamese food for lunch Enjoy private english speaking guide services plus hotel transfers included Let your experienced guide tell you the history of the Vietnam DMZ Explore Museums and important sites of the Vietnam war Dine on traditional Vietnamese food for lunch Enjoy private english speaking guide services plus hotel transfers included What We Love:   What We Love: Rise bright and early to travel north to the DMZ on Highway 1, known for the breath taking mountain ranges which run west to east along the border of Vietnam and Laos to the sea. This narrow strip of land once included the wartime boundary between North and South Vietnam which, contrary to its name, was the site of ferocious fighting. Stop off at significant battle sights and hear facts and stories of a country at war. When you arrive you'll visit the Citadel of Quang Tri, a major battle site in 1972, before crossing the Hien Luong Bridge - which marks the former border separating North Vietnam from the South. The tour stops by at the Vinh Moc Tunnels which sheltered an entire village of civilians for two and a half years! See the astonishing photographs and find out more at the small museum. At this stage you'll need some reenergizing with a traditional Vietnamese lunch, then you'll continue to Khe Sanh, a significant 1968 battle site, before returning to Hue.
strTitle: Hue DMZ Full Day Private Tour

strIntroduction: Spend half a day at two important places in Danang's history - Cham Museum and the Marble Mountains Visit the Cham Museum which has the largest collection of artifacts and artwork from the ancient Cham Kingdom in the world Explore the Marble Mountains where caves served as temples, battlegrounds and hospitals during the turbulent years of the Vietnam War Gain the most out of the cultural experience with an English speaking guide who will explain the significance of these landmarks Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off (Danang area) Visit the Cham Museum which has the largest collection of artifacts and artwork from the ancient Cham Kingdom in the world Explore the Marble Mountains where caves served as temples, battlegrounds and hospitals during the turbulent years of the Vietnam War Gain the most out of the cultural experience with an English speaking guide who will explain the significance of these landmarks Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off (Danang area) What We Love:   What We Love: Danang, Central Vietnam's most populous city, is home to the largest collection of Cham sculptures and artwork in the world. At the Cham Museum, your guide will share stories on the culture, history and daily lives of Vietnam's ancient people as you explore the relics of Vietnam's past. Venture south to the Marble Mountains - a collection of five marble and limestone hills also known as the Five Elements Mountains: metal, water, wood, fire and earth. Look out for the Buddhist sanctuaries that can be found within the mountains as you make your way to the summit of a peak.

Fly above the jungle on 10 ziplines on a real outdoor adventure Feel like a true Indian Jones as you cross hanging bridges and zip down a 50 meter descent Learn about the exotic flora and fauna of the beautiful Angkor Park Don't miss out on a chance to spot gibbons in their natural environment Fly above the jungle on 10 ziplines on a real outdoor adventure Feel like a true Indian Jones as you cross hanging bridges and zip down a 50 meter descent Learn about the exotic flora and fauna of the beautiful Angkor Park Don't miss out on a chance to spot gibbons in their natural environment What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the beautiful Angkor Park, Flight of the Gibbon in Siem Reap is the only zipline staged in a UNESCO World Heritage site. As you are zip above the evergreen forest and take stunning photos from the air, don't forget to keep an eye out for the gibbons and a chance to see them in their natural environment.
