strIntroduction: Take a day off from temple sightseeing and discover Cambodian village life. Experience life as a local and help out around the village by supporting a local charity tourism project Join a local host family in a rural farming village and help out with daily tasks Support responsible tourism and a local communities charity (5% of the tour price goes directly to the charity) With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour for up to 5 - you can be sure that you'll get a personalized experience Enjoy a casual picnic lunch with your Khmer host family Transportation to and from the village is provided plus the insight of a local guide Join a local host family in a rural farming village and help out with daily tasks Join a local host family in a rural farming village and help out with daily tasks Support responsible tourism and a local communities charity (5% of the tour price goes directly to the charity) Support responsible tourism and a local communities charity (5% of the tour price goes directly to the charity) With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour for up to 5 - you can be sure that you'll get a personalized experience With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour for up to 5 - you can be sure that you'll get a personalized experience Enjoy a casual picnic lunch with your Khmer host family Enjoy a casual picnic lunch with your Khmer host family Transportation to and from the village is provided plus the insight of a local guide Transportation to and from the village is provided plus the insight of a local guide What We Love:   What We Love: When visiting a country as a tourist, it's often very easy to ignore the poverty of the beautiful country you're in. The Day in a Life program strives to bridge the gap between tourists and ‘Type 1' village families (those that struggle to meet daily needs, and often for food too). A local host family will welcome you into their home and lives for the day. They receive a small payment for this task and a larger contribution is made to a village fund, used for village projects like water filters and wells. Step into a villager's shoes and help out with daily tasks: plant or harvest rice, weave thatch for roofs, create wall panels, plant vegetables or trees, make 'prahoc' or rice wine. Every tour is different and tasks depend on the time of year, family needs and village goings-on.

Start your day with sunrise over Angkor Wat then pedal Siem Reap's unexplored trails and ancient temples Enjoy a crowd-free sunrise and tour of Angkor Wat, led by your knowledgeable local guide Enjoy breakfast by the temples and later a lunch by a peaceful reservoir Spend the morning pedaling through Siem Reap's back trails, to both popular and more hidden temples With tour groups of no more than 8, you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse Australian/Cambodian ownership perfectly balances local knowledge, customer service and community enrichment Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return hotel transfer Enjoy a crowd-free sunrise and tour of Angkor Wat, led by your knowledgeable local guide Enjoy a crowd-free sunrise and tour of Angkor Wat, led by your knowledgeable local guide Enjoy breakfast by the temples and later a lunch by a peaceful reservoir Enjoy breakfast by the temples and later a lunch by a peaceful reservoir Spend the morning pedaling through Siem Reap's back trails, to both popular and more hidden temples Spend the morning pedaling through Siem Reap's back trails, to both popular and more hidden temples With tour groups of no more than 8, you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse With tour groups of no more than 8, you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse Australian/Cambodian ownership perfectly balances local knowledge, customer service and community enrichment Australian/Cambodian ownership perfectly balances local knowledge, customer service and community enrichment Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return hotel transfer Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return hotel transfer What We Love:   What We Love: Wake up to incredible sunrise views of Angkor Wat silhouetted against the skyline. This unforgettable morning cycle guides you through the back trails among the ruins of the Angkor Kingdom. With an early start, you'll join a small group of early risers eager to see the sunrise. Once they've returned to bed, you'll have the rest of the morning to explore the Angkor temples in the soft dawn light and, most welcomingly, without the tourist crowds. Follow your guide on a walking tour of Angkor Wat before settling down for a peaceful breakfast just outside the temple grounds. Once you're revitalized, the rest of the day will be spent riding the back trails through ruins and forests, with stops at both iconic and lesser-known temples including Bayon and Ta Prom. You'll take lunch by a small reservoir then as the day heats up, you'll drive back to town and your hotel.

Just 10 minutes from Siem Reap center and you'll be driven to your own private oasis for a full evening of culinary indulgence Spoil yourselves with a 3-course private dining experience, perfect for couples or small groups of friends A private chef and personal waiter will look after you throughout the evening Begin with a sunset welcome drink then enjoy a bottle of wine, beer and soft drinks throughout the meal Spoil yourselves with a 3-course private dining experience, perfect for couples or small groups of friends Spoil yourselves with a 3-course private dining experience, perfect for couples or small groups of friends A private chef and personal waiter will look after you throughout the evening A private chef and personal waiter will look after you throughout the evening Begin with a sunset welcome drink then enjoy a bottle of wine, beer and soft drinks throughout the meal Begin with a sunset welcome drink then enjoy a bottle of wine, beer and soft drinks throughout the meal What We Love:   What We Love: Birthday, anniversary, honeymoon? Or simply because you're on holiday! This is Siem Reap's most unique dining experience, perfect for couples and small groups of friends. Your own private chef will cook a three-course meal, just for you, which you'll enjoy in a private pavilion. Begin with a welcome drink over sunset then relax with a glass of wine as you watch dusk turn into night. Bamboo flares and candle lighting create a romantic atmosphere, and your personal waiter will ensure you have the perfect evening.

Travel 75km of Siem Reap's quiet back roads and discover beautiful temples, countryside and people Discover the true Cambodia with a full-day motorbike tour Visit secluded temples and ancient ruins, legacies of the Khmer Empire Practice before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide - this tour is perfect for beginners and serious bikers alike Find a relaxing spot for a BBQ lunch where you can swim, fish and relax Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! Discover the true Cambodia with a full-day motorbike tour Discover the true Cambodia with a full-day motorbike tour Visit secluded temples and ancient ruins, legacies of the Khmer Empire Visit secluded temples and ancient ruins, legacies of the Khmer Empire Practice before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide - this tour is perfect for beginners and serious bikers alike Practice before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide - this tour is perfect for beginners and serious bikers alike Find a relaxing spot for a BBQ lunch where you can swim, fish and relax Find a relaxing spot for a BBQ lunch where you can swim, fish and relax Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! What We Love:   What We Love: How best to see Cambodia? Like the locals of course! The Khmer people's main means of transport is motorbike, and it's the quickest way to escape the tourist traps and see the real Cambodia. You'll get a true sense of freedom zooming along the Khmer trails through green rice fields, lush bamboo groves and remote jungle. The roads are virtually traffic-free and the 125cc Honda Dreams are easy to ride. But just to be on the safe side, you'll get extensive instructions and the chance to scoot about and test your skills first. If you're not feeling confident, not to worry, just hop on the back of the guide's bike instead. Visit several low-key sites including the isolated Koh Khrong temple before heading over to an ancient reservoir for a delicious BBQ. Take a refreshing swim, go inner tubing, try your hand at fishing or relax in the surrounding nature whilst lunch is prepared. What's more, the community benefits directly from every visitor through a specially set up development fund.

Cycle quiet back trails and explore beautiful temples in the stunning and friendly Cambodian countryside Embark on a 30km biking adventure of nature and temples Dig into lunch at a local restaurant, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kids sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Embark on a 30km biking adventure of nature and temples Embark on a 30km biking adventure of nature and temples Dig into lunch at a local restaurant, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water throughout Dig into lunch at a local restaurant, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kids sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Kids sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved What We Love:   What We Love: Escape the crowds, the busy roads and the well-worn trail at Angkor. After a riverside cycle to visit the amazing Angkor Wat, we then leave the road and spend the rest of the day on charming, quiet trails through majestic structures. Get up close to Ta Prohm, The Elephant Terrace, and Bayon as well as some less visited temples along the way. Finish by returning on a red dirt road and small rural village trail back to town. With a commitment to unique, carefully created tours, this is the authentic biking adventure you've been looking for. Led by an informative and entertaining Cambodian guide, you'll bike on countryside tracks and past stunning temples – it's suitable for anyone who can ride a bike and has a taste for adventure.

Learn to cook up to six traditional Cambodian meals including a refreshing Mango Salad, a mouth-watering Fish Amok, crispy spring rolls and sweet Sticky Rice Balls for dessert Learn to create three (AM or PM class) or six (full day course) delicious Cambodian dishes led by a local chef Visit a local family at a rural village to learn about daily cooking in a Khmer household Classes accommodate a maximum of 6 students, each with a private workstation Receive recipe cards so you can recreate the delicious dishes when you return home Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town by tuk tuk Learn to create three (AM or PM class) or six (full day course) delicious Cambodian dishes led by a local chef Learn to create three (AM or PM class) or six (full day course) delicious Cambodian dishes led by a local chef Visit a local family at a rural village to learn about daily cooking in a Khmer household Visit a local family at a rural village to learn about daily cooking in a Khmer household Classes accommodate a maximum of 6 students, each with a private workstation Classes accommodate a maximum of 6 students, each with a private workstation Receive recipe cards so you can recreate the delicious dishes when you return home Receive recipe cards so you can recreate the delicious dishes when you return home Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town by tuk tuk Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town by tuk tuk What We Love:   What We Love: Taking a cooking class is an unmissable experience when in Siem Reap. Memories of those mouthwatering Cambodian flavors will stay with you long after you return home. These classes start with a nice touch: a visit to a local family. You'll take a stroll through the village, learn about homegrown herbs and vegetables and discover more about cooking in a Khmer household. A gift of rice is provided to the family as thanks for their participation. Then it's time to get stuck in! Together with your local chef and guide, you'll get a hands-on cooking experience with tips and recipe cards so you can reproduce the dishes at home. Mango salad, fresh spring rolls, Cambodian curry and tasty desserts are some of your menu choices. And the best part? You can taste all your creations once the cooking's over!

Watch in absolute awe at the talents of these young performers as they juggle, dance, perform acrobatic and aerial acts, and use fire and contortion in an explosive show, certain to blow you away Witness incredible feats of traditional and modern theatre Watch the show from the most exclusive viewpoint, with front and center seats reserved just for you Receive a bottle of water prior to the performance and a special gift from the Phare Boutique afterwards Support a charitable organization, dedicated to preserving Cambodian arts and helping disadvantaged local youngsters Witness incredible feats of traditional and modern theatre Witness incredible feats of traditional and modern theatre Watch the show from the most exclusive viewpoint, with front and center seats reserved just for you Watch the show from the most exclusive viewpoint, with front and center seats reserved just for you Receive a bottle of water prior to the performance and a special gift from the Phare Boutique afterwards Receive a bottle of water prior to the performance and a special gift from the Phare Boutique afterwards Support a charitable organization, dedicated to preserving Cambodian arts and helping disadvantaged local youngsters Support a charitable organization, dedicated to preserving Cambodian arts and helping disadvantaged local youngsters What We Love:   What We Love: This traditional Cambodian performance is a phenomenon not to miss! You'll be left in absolute awe at the talents of these brilliant young performers. An amazing blend of traditional and modern theater, music, dance, acrobatics, juggling and contortion all beautifully choreographed in a story about Cambodian lives and society. Though performed in Khmer with English subtitles on a screen, the story is easy to follow without words and you'll probably be too enthralled by the performers to keep up with the narrative anyway! If you're still not convinced, the thousands of five star reviews online should be enough to persuade you. The show is a project of the PPS Association, a non-profit organization founded by eight young Cambodian ex-refugees of the Khmer Rouge regime, committed to reviving the Cambodian arts.

Enjoy a two hour Walk and Talk introduction to a traditional Cambodian village, including a visit to the local pagoda, the HUSK Community School and workshop. Take a 2-2.5 hour walk around a typical Cambodian village, observe daily farming activities and gain a deeper knowledge of Cambodian life Support the village community with $5 of your fee donated to a village fund With tour groups of no more than 4 people, you'll be interacting with the community in a respectful and meaningful way An ideal tour for budding photographers (your guide will tell you if anyone does not wish to be photographed) What's more, return hotel transfer by tuk tuk is included in the tour Take a 2-2.5 hour walk around a typical Cambodian village, observe daily farming activities and gain a deeper knowledge of Cambodian life Take a 2-2.5 hour walk around a typical Cambodian village, observe daily farming activities and gain a deeper knowledge of Cambodian life Support the village community with $5 of your fee donated to a village fund Support the village community with $5 of your fee donated to a village fund With tour groups of no more than 4 people, you'll be interacting with the community in a respectful and meaningful way With tour groups of no more than 4 people, you'll be interacting with the community in a respectful and meaningful way An ideal tour for budding photographers (your guide will tell you if anyone does not wish to be photographed) An ideal tour for budding photographers (your guide will tell you if anyone does not wish to be photographed) What's more, return hotel transfer by tuk tuk is included in the tour What's more, return hotel transfer by tuk tuk is included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: This exciting walking tour takes you out of the city and into the Cambodian rice fields. You will get to visit a local village and learn all about the traditional stilt homes and the life around them. The tour includes a visit to the active Pagoda and the HUSK NGO English school. Taking about 2.5 hours and covering the distance of 2 kilometers, the tour is a great chance to explore quaint village life, interact with the locals and have your many questions answered. With beautiful country views, you will have lots of chances to capture the nature of Cambodia and its friendly locals. Your English speaking guide will give you all the missing pieces and you will return home with a traditional Khmer sun hat as a gift.

Be cleansed with sacred water said to bring peace and happiness, amongst beautiful surrounds, to the sound of sacred chants Receive a traditional Buddhist blessing at Wat Athvea temple or at Arang Pagoda Your English-speaking guide will lead you through the process and explain the ritual's meaning This is a beautiful and traditional way to bless a newly wed couple or for anyone needing a bit of extra luck! Enjoy convenient hotel transfers to take you to the beautiful countryside Receive a traditional Buddhist blessing at Wat Athvea temple or at Arang Pagoda Receive a traditional Buddhist blessing at Wat Athvea temple or at Arang Pagoda Your English-speaking guide will lead you through the process and explain the ritual's meaning Your English-speaking guide will lead you through the process and explain the ritual's meaning This is a beautiful and traditional way to bless a newly wed couple or for anyone needing a bit of extra luck! This is a beautiful and traditional way to bless a newly wed couple or for anyone needing a bit of extra luck! Enjoy convenient hotel transfers to take you to the beautiful countryside Enjoy convenient hotel transfers to take you to the beautiful countryside What We Love:   What We Love: Water Blessings are a traditional Cambodian practice that date back to ancient times. You'll be driven to an ancient pagoda, nestled in the beautiful countryside outside Siem Reap where you'll have a choice of two rituals. The first is almost a taster: a blessing accompanied by a light sprinkling of water. The second is the real deal: you'll be completely covered in water blessed by the monks (don't worry, you'll get a sarong to change into for the experience), whilst the monks chant in unison. At the end of your blessing, you'll receive a special red tie that signifies the ritual that was performed. This is a unique experience for individuals but can also be a special way for newly weds to celebrate their union as it's said that the blessing brings peace and happiness.

Connect with the real Cambodia. Embark on an easy ride through the Siem Reap countryside, learn about village life and try some delicious snacks Follow back road routes and unsealed village roads to discover a very different side to Siem Reap, far from the tourist crowds Try some tasty local snacks and fruit along the way and clean water provided throughout Let your entertaining and informative English-speaking local guide look after you and show you the way Flat tracks and non-hilly roads but with some small dirt trails means this tour is ideal for intermediate riders (not suitable for beginners) Follow back road routes and unsealed village roads to discover a very different side to Siem Reap, far from the tourist crowds Follow back road routes and unsealed village roads to discover a very different side to Siem Reap, far from the tourist crowds Try some tasty local snacks and fruit along the way and clean water provided throughout Try some tasty local snacks and fruit along the way and clean water provided throughout Let your entertaining and informative English-speaking local guide look after you and show you the way Let your entertaining and informative English-speaking local guide look after you and show you the way Flat tracks and non-hilly roads but with some small dirt trails means this tour is ideal for intermediate riders (not suitable for beginners) Flat tracks and non-hilly roads but with some small dirt trails means this tour is ideal for intermediate riders (not suitable for beginners) What We Love:   What We Love: Leave the temples behind and connect with the real Cambodia. Start with a leisurely ride along the Siem Reap River, then leave the tarmac for the narrower dirt paths leading you deeper into the scenic countryside. You'll pedal through friendly villages, where children run along waving you hello. Glance about to see wine and sugar production, basket weaving, rice farming and all sorts of activity that maintains the countryside buzz. Feeling peckish? Make a stop for some unique Cambodian snacks and fruit before making tracks back to town for a midday return. Prepare for a morning of laughter as your highly entertaining guide shows you the way and imparts local knowledge.

Discover the key to the Angkor Kingdom's agricultural prosperity and enjoy a day of exercise as you ride the countryside and villages west of Siem Reap and paddle through a small floating community and the great Tonle Sap Lake Embark on a 25-30km biking adventure with a 1 hour kayaking excursion to the villages and lakes outside of Siem Reap Dig in to a local lunch, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water provided throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kid-sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Support a local charity, committed to helping the community through eco-tourism Embark on a 25-30km biking adventure with a 1 hour kayaking excursion to the villages and lakes outside of Siem Reap Embark on a 25-30km biking adventure with a 1 hour kayaking excursion to the villages and lakes outside of Siem Reap Dig in to a local lunch, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water provided throughout Dig in to a local lunch, plus enjoy fruit, snacks and water provided throughout Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Listen closely to your local English-speaking guide who will tell you all about the area Kid-sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Kid-sized bikes are available too so the whole family can get involved Support a local charity, committed to helping the community through eco-tourism Support a local charity, committed to helping the community through eco-tourism What We Love:   What We Love: Hop out of bed for an early morning ride along the great irrigation reservoirs of the Angkor period, the West Baray. By late morning you find yourself in a small village, where lives are supported by seasonal agriculture. Join a local resident for a walk ‘n' talk explaining the community workings then it's time for a tasty lunch and some hammock chill time. After lunch, you'll paddle through the floating villages by kayak. Explore the neighborhood and the mangrove forest before venturing onto Tonle Sap Lake where the sheer size of this body of water will become apparent. Your guide will explain the phenomenon that has resulted in the lake's eight-meter depth variance and why this lake is vital to Cambodia's survival. This is a tour for any adventurer who wants to explore beyond the tourist crowds of Siem Reap and support a company whose goal is to protect the local Cambodian community.

Tour Siem Reap with a private guide who will show you the best locations to capture your perfect holiday snaps Tailor the tour to suit your personal preferences. Temples, landscapes, people – whatever you want to capture Tap into the knowledge of your local guide throughout the tour Let your guide steer you towards photo opportunities that are respectful of Cambodian culture and people Tailor the tour to suit your personal preferences. Temples, landscapes, people – whatever you want to capture Tailor the tour to suit your personal preferences. Temples, landscapes, people – whatever you want to capture you Tap into the knowledge of your local guide throughout the tour Tap into the knowledge of your local guide throughout the tour Let your guide steer you towards photo opportunities that are respectful of Cambodian culture and people Let your guide steer you towards photo opportunities that are respectful of Cambodian culture and people What We Love:   What We Love: Even the shortest stay in Cambodia will have you in awe of this beautiful country and adamant that you'll soon start your career as a travel photographer. Capture moss-covered temples, rice terrace landscapes and the wonderful faces of Cambodia whilst being respectful of local people, culture and customs. With a completely flexible itinerary, the team personalizes the tour to match the experiences you are looking for. Your guide, with extensive photography experience and a deep knowledge of the area, will help you find the ideal locations for capturing some amazing photographs. Together you'll find the best places, uncover hidden secrets and get access to places you'd have otherwise missed. This isn't about how to use your camera, it's about getting you to the right place at the right time!

This 145km Cambodian motorbiking adventure will not only seriously pump up your adrenalin and let you ride freely through the beautiful countryside but it'll give you a good dose of historical insight too! Discover the true Cambodia, far from the tourist trails, with a full-day motorbike tour Visit the historical Phnom Kulen where the 'Age of Angkor' began, swim in a waterfall and see a giant reclining Buddha Take in the incredible scenery of the Kulen Mountain plateau and visit hidden temples Practice riding before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide instead Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! Discover the true Cambodia, far from the tourist trails, with a full-day motorbike tour Discover the true Cambodia, far from the tourist trails, with a full-day motorbike tour Visit the historical Phnom Kulen where the 'Age of Angkor' began, swim in a waterfall and see a giant reclining Buddha Visit the historical Phnom Kulen where the 'Age of Angkor' began, swim in a waterfall and see a giant reclining Buddha Take in the incredible scenery of the Kulen Mountain plateau and visit hidden temples Take in the incredible scenery of the Kulen Mountain plateau and visit hidden temples Practice riding before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide instead Practice riding before setting off or share the bike with your experienced guide instead Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! Tap into the local knowledge of your Khmer guide and make the most of his translator skills! What We Love:   What We Love: Up for an adventure? If you're feeling daring and want to really get off-road, we've got the perfect tour for you. Drive to the place where it all began, where Jayavarman crowned himself godking in 802AD. Rich in history, Phnom Kulen is where the ‘Age of Angkor' began, and is one of only two places in Cambodia where Buddha is reputed to have set foot. Visit a giant reclining Buddha and a scenic waterfall (don't forget your swimwear!) Then push on further, exploring kilometers of complex back trails, deep jungle tracks and hidden temples, including the stunning and sought-after stone elephant and lion statues. Tours are fully customizable, so if you want to take it easier, an alternative route takes you to the isolated pagoda of Preah Kral, with beautiful views of the Kulen Mountain plateau. This is the ultimate moto experience but if you're not feeling confident, not to worry, just hop on the back of the guide's bike instead.

What comes to mind when you hear ‘Angkor'? Temples of course! This day tour takes you to Siem Reap's most beautiful temples, led by a local guide, a wealth of knowledge on the subject Visit Cambodia's most spectacular temples of Ta Prohm, Bayon and of course, Angkor Wat Enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch in a shaded area by a temple Appreciate the knowledge and friendliness of your local Khmer guide With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour - you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town Visit Cambodia's most spectacular temples of Ta Prohm, Bayon and of course, Angkor Wat Visit Cambodia's most spectacular temples of Ta Prohm, Bayon and of course, Angkor Wat Enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch in a shaded area by a temple Enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch in a shaded area by a temple Appreciate the knowledge and friendliness of your local Khmer guide Appreciate the knowledge and friendliness of your local Khmer guide With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour - you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse With tour groups of no more than 8 - or even better, a private tour - you can be sure that you won't be visiting sights en masse Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town Enjoy complimentary hotel pick-up and return transfer back to town What We Love:   What We Love: Temples, temples, temples… well, that is why you're in Siem Reap after all. This tour is hands down the best way to explore Cambodia's incredible feats of religious architecture. Visit Ta Prohm temple, where ancient stones and massive tree roots are locked in battle, then it's onwards to Angkor Thom ancient walled city and the mystical Bayon temple adorned with hundreds of smiling faces carved into the sandstone. Roam further into the temple complex and immerse yourself in stories told by your local Khmer guide before seeking out a shaded area to enjoy a hot Cambodian picnic lunch. End the tour with a bang: a visit to the jewel of the Khmer Empire, the amazing Angkor Wat. Founding inscriptions are plentiful but the mystery lies in how this great empire collapsed. Reflect on Cambodia's troubled history and contemplate the secrets as you stroll through this masterpiece of architecture and engineering.

Breathe in Nepal's history and culture through a half-day trip to two heritage sites Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Take in the grandiose architecture of palaces, Hindu and Buddhist temples and shrines Learn about Nepal's political, religious and cultural heritage Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambunath Stupa To reach the temple, climb the 365-step staircase through a forest populated with monkeys Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Take in the grandiose architecture of palaces, Hindu and Buddhist temples and shrines Take in the grandiose architecture of palaces, Hindu and Buddhist temples and shrines Learn about Nepal's political, religious and cultural heritage Learn about Nepal's political, religious and cultural heritage Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambunath Stupa Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambunath Stupa To reach the temple, climb the 365-step staircase through a forest populated with monkeys To reach the temple, climb the 365-step staircase through a forest populated with monkeys What We Love:   What We Love: Uncover the wonders of Nepal in this day trip to two UNESCO-listed World Heritage Sites. Explore Durbar Square, once the kingdom throne of the capital's rulers, and take in the ancient beauty of its numerous temples, shrines and idols. You'll also visit the Swayambunath Stupa, known as the most important Buddhist shrine in all of Nepal. Nicknamed Monkey Temple, the Stupa is situated atop a hillside that can be reached through a monkey-populated forest. Spend half a day getting to know this mountainous country through its rich, ancient history, as you thread landmark sites of religious and cultural landscape.

Soak in Nepal's rich, ancient culture at two royal cities Explore ancient Patan and see why it's called the 'City of Living Art' Learn about the city's Buddhist and Hindu heritage from centuries-old museum artifacts See Bhaktapur Durbar Square in Nepal's 'City of Devotees', rife with religious sites and art Be taken back in time as you walk past one sky-high pagoda after another Marvel at the 30m-tall Nyatapola Temple, constantly ringing with bells and percussion Explore ancient Patan and see why it's called the 'City of Living Art' Explore ancient Patan and see why it's called the 'City of Living Art' Learn about the city's Buddhist and Hindu heritage from centuries-old museum artifacts Learn about the city's Buddhist and Hindu heritage from centuries-old museum artifacts See Bhaktapur Durbar Square in Nepal's 'City of Devotees', rife with religious sites and art See Bhaktapur Durbar Square in Nepal's 'City of Devotees', rife with religious sites and art Be taken back in time as you walk past one sky-high pagoda after another Be taken back in time as you walk past one sky-high pagoda after another Marvel at the 30m-tall Nyatapola Temple, constantly ringing with bells and percussion Marvel at the 30m-tall Nyatapola Temple, constantly ringing with bells and percussion What We Love:   What We Love: In Kathmandu Valley are three ancient cities, once independently ruled by their respective Malla kings: Kathmandu, Patan and Bhaktapur. In this day trip, visit Patan and Bhaktapur, home to cultural UNESCO World Heritage Sites that hark back to Nepal's rich past. You'll learn to appreciate Patan's name in Sanskrit, Lalitpur, which means ‘City of Living Art.' (Hint: it's home to the valley's finest sculptors and craftsmen.) Over in Bhaktapur, experience what it's like to wade slowly back in time, with streets and architecture retaining their olden, brickmade charm. All throughout, pay close attention to their shared religious heritage. Of Buddhist and Hindu backgrounds, both Patan and Bhaktapur are wealthy with temples, shrines, idols and sculptures in honor of their gods – giving you an endless count of sights over which to marvel.

Get a taste of local cuisine set to a cultural dance performance Savor a delicious dinner meal of Nepali staples at a well-loved local restaurant Enjoy a Mayar Dance showcase as you dine Relish the sensory feast as you gain a better appreciation for local culture and tradition Savor a delicious dinner meal of Nepali staples at a well-loved local restaurant Savor a delicious dinner meal of Nepali staples at a well-loved local restaurant Enjoy a Mayar Dance showcase as you dine Enjoy a Mayar Dance showcase as you dine Relish the sensory feast as you gain a better appreciation for local culture and tradition Relish the sensory feast as you gain a better appreciation for local culture and tradition What We Love:   What We Love: Unwind after a day around Nepal's ancient cities with a cultural feast of dinner and dancing. This evening activity features a meal at one of three renowned local restaurants: Nepalli Chulo, Bhojan Griha or Utsav Restaurant, where you'll be served with an assortment of traditional Nepali dishes. Savor the strong and aromatic flavors of lamb curry, scoop up some dal bhat – a rice dish of lentils served with pickles, meat (or fish), and other sides – and finally get a taste of sel roti, the popular local snack. Mid-dinner, professional performers will showcase a special number featuring the Mayar (peacock) Dance, delivering you a wonderful nighttime feast in celebration of food and culture!

Go back in time with a trip to two of the Himalayan country's old villages Meander amongst the residents of Bungamati as they go about their day-to-day activities See the Rato Machhendranath Temple, a Hindu temple for the patron god of Patan Visit the Newari village of Khokana and get to know the local farming community Learn about its renowned mustard oil and harvesting process See the 3-storey temple dedicated the local mother goddess, Shikali Mai Meander amongst the residents of Bungamati as they go about their day-to-day activities Meander amongst the residents of Bungamati as they go about their day-to-day activities See the Rato Machhendranath Temple, a Hindu temple for the patron god of Patan See the Rato Machhendranath Temple, a Hindu temple for the patron god of Patan Visit the Newari village of Khokana and get to know the local farming community Visit the Newari village of Khokana and get to know the local farming community Learn about its renowned mustard oil and harvesting process Learn about its renowned mustard oil and harvesting process See the 3-storey temple dedicated the local mother goddess, Shikali Mai See the 3-storey temple dedicated the local mother goddess, Shikali Mai What We Love:   What We Love: Venture into the ancient villages of Kathmandu Valley in this exploration of Bungamati and Khokana. Because of their relative inaccessibility, visiting the towns is akin to going back in time – a time when locals gather in main squares and the call of everyday work intermingles with communal life. Such are what you'll see on this journey, with Bungamati's resident woodcarvers and craftsfolk hard at work. The place is home to the shrine of Rato Macchendranath, patron god of Patan, alongside other religious monuments. You can expect a similar ambience in Khokana, where locals live largely off of their agriculture. Learn about their renowned produce, mustard oil, and the unique way it is harvested, then pay a visit to the landmark three-storey temple dedicated to Shikali Mai, the local mother goddess.

Get cooking as you meet and learn from local Nepali families Learn to shop at the market as you source ingredients for your cooking classes Meet a Nepali family, from whom you'll learn to make local dishes Pick up local Nepali phrases and cooking terminology along the way Get a taste for everyday life as you share your cooking with the family! Get a taste for everyday life as you share your cooking with the family! What We Love:   What We Love: They say one of the best ways to know a culture is through its cuisine – so expect to enjoy a slice of authentic Nepali life in this authentic, local cooking class! Opt for a morning or afternoon session, and meet local host families for cookouts in time for lunch, or for dinner. You'll learn to whip up everyday home-cooked meals, featuring authentic local foodstuff like dhalbhat, a savory rice special served with lentils, curry meat or fish, and various spices; momos, the local version of Japanese gyozas; and sel roti, the sweet bread treat. You'll also pick up some Nepali phrases along the way, and get a taste for everyday living as you share your own cooking with the family!

Drive to Nagarkot Hilltop, renowned for its incredible sunrise views Watch the sun rise from the perch of Nagarkot Hilltop Glimpse picturesque, snowcapped mountain peaks of eastern Nepal Take in incredible views of the Himalayan mountain range and see if you could spot Mt. Everest Watch the sun rise from the perch of Nagarkot Hilltop Watch the sun rise from the perch of Nagarkot Hilltop Glimpse picturesque, snowcapped mountain peaks of eastern Nepal Glimpse picturesque, snowcapped mountain peaks of eastern Nepal Take in incredible views of the Himalayan mountain range and see if you could spot Mt. Everest Take in incredible views of the Himalayan mountain range and see if you could spot Mt. Everest What We Love:   What We Love: See one of the most incredible sunrises from atop Nagarkot hill. Situated east of Kathmandu at over 2,000m above sea level, this spot is known best for its panoramic views of the rising sun. Begin your day in the dark and drive up to Nagarkot Hill Station, where you'll also see the rest of the Himalayan Range including, yes, Mt. Everest. Then wait as the early splinters of light cuts through the horizon – it's an experience for the books you're sure to treasure for a long, long time.

Hike from Nagarkot to Changunarayan and take in spectacular views and structures Explore the hillside town of Nagarkot, home to spectacular Himalayan views Glimpse daily life for the Tamang and Newar ethnic groups as you walk through scenic pastures and fields Visit the Changu Narayan Temple, a World Heritage Site See the incredible stone, wood and metal carvings that date back to the Lichhavi period (4th-9th century) Explore the hillside town of Nagarkot, home to spectacular Himalayan views Explore the hillside town of Nagarkot, home to spectacular Himalayan views Glimpse daily life for the Tamang and Newar ethnic groups as you walk through scenic pastures and fields Glimpse daily life for the Tamang and Newar ethnic groups as you walk through scenic pastures and fields Visit the Changu Narayan Temple, a World Heritage Site Visit the Changu Narayan Temple, a World Heritage Site See the incredible stone, wood and metal carvings that date back to the Lichhavi period (4th-9th century) See the incredible stone, wood and metal carvings that date back to the Lichhavi period (4th-9th century) What We Love:   What We Love: Nepal is one of the best places in the world to go trekking, and this route is a great place to start for those unused to heavy hiking, preferring a leisurely walking journey. Take in the spectacular Himalayan range in the hillside town of Nagarkot, famed for its sunrise views, and glimpse the majestic Annapurna mountain range to the west and Everest to the east. From there, you'll be led to the Changunarayan Temple, a Vishnu shrine dating back to the 4th century. Made of elaborate carvings in stone, wood and metal, the oldest temple in Kathmandu is an incredible work of art to behold – so much so that it's one of seven World Heritage Sites in the country.

Bike downhill from the peak of Kakani, perched along a ridge 2,073m above sea level Bike from the top through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's forests and main water supply Take in captivating views of the Himalayas on your way down Pass through the mystical Budhanilkantha, home to the slumbering Vishnu sculpture Bike from the top through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's forests and main water supply Bike from the top through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's forests and main water supply Take in captivating views of the Himalayas on your way down Take in captivating views of the Himalayas on your way down Pass through the mystical Budhanilkantha, home to the slumbering Vishnu sculpture Pass through the mystical Budhanilkantha, home to the slumbering Vishnu sculpture What We Love:   What We Love: Trek downhill on mountain bike from the 2,732m-high ridge of Kakani. Wind through Shivapuri Nagarjun National Park, home to the valley's water supply and over 170 winged species and rare orchids. The forest is among the last of Kathmandu's woodlands, making it one of the more nature-dense venues to explore in the valley. From there you'll make it to Budhanilkantha, an area off tourist routes, typically reserved for devotees of Buddhism and Hinduism. Located here is the reclining black stone statue of Vishnu, resting upon the coils of Ananta, the 11-headed snake god, which you might glimpse through the fenced enclosure en route to Kathmandu city. It's a daylong journey that begins at the top, dispatching you into an exhilarating biking adventure from the countryside to the city.

Experience the thrill of descending Kakani's canyons Enjoy a 3- to 4-hour canyoning adventure Abseil down rock formations and waterfalls 20m to 60m in height! Plunge into the cool waters of natural pools Be guided by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Enjoy a 3- to 4-hour canyoning adventure Enjoy a 3- to 4-hour canyoning adventure Abseil down rock formations and waterfalls 20m to 60m in height! Abseil down rock formations and waterfalls 20m to 60m in height! Plunge into the cool waters of natural pools Plunge into the cool waters of natural pools Be guided by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Be guided by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge What We Love:   What We Love: Embark on a thrilling mountain descent in the canyons of Kakani, just 30 minutes outside of Kathmandu city. Resting on a ridge some 2,073m above sea level, the village offers incredible sights of the Himalaya, from Annapurna to Everest. It's a breathtaking scenery to soak in as you scramble and abseil down rock faces, navigate between waterfalls and plunge into pools. Be guided by experienced canyoneers, who'll brief you prior to your adventure and take the lead in your expedition. You'll also be equipped with full safety instructions and gear, so leave you fears at the door and enjoy the downward climb!

Pass through local villages and make your way up to the legendary Namobuddha on bike Embark on the revered Buddhist Pilgrimage and see the Namobuddha – by mountain bike! Begin your journey from Dhulikhel, a Newari town blessed with incredible views of the Himalaya Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on top of mountain Get to Panauti, a picturesque old city, en route back to Kathmandu Embark on the revered Buddhist Pilgrimage and see the Namobuddha – by mountain bike! Embark on the revered Buddhist Pilgrimage and see the Namobuddha – by mountain bike! Begin your journey from Dhulikhel, a Newari town blessed with incredible views of the Himalaya Begin your journey from Dhulikhel, a Newari town blessed with incredible views of the Himalaya Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on top of mountain Enjoy lunch at a local restaurant on top of mountain Get to Panauti, a picturesque old city, en route back to Kathmandu Get to Panauti, a picturesque old city, en route back to Kathmandu What We Love:   What We Love: According to legend, there once was a prince named Mahasattya who offered himself to a starving tigress and her baby cubs. Today, the Namobuddha, situated at an altitude of approx. 2,500m, marks the commemorative site of this incredible tale – a remarkable story to keep in mind as you bike to the statue from Dhulikhel. Journey through paved roads, rough trails, and rice terraces. Once at the Namobuddha, take in the grandeur of the temple, stupa and shrines on-site. Typically a multi-day pilgrimage, this biking adventure takes you through the same local villages in a single day. You'll also be served lunch, before continuing on your journey to Panauti, and heading back to Kathmandu.

Paddle through the rapids of the famed Trisuli River in this thrilling adventure with public or private return transfer to Kathmandu, or, if you're heading to Pokhara, the most unique way to get there! Get briefed on river rafting and safety procedures by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Glimpse scenic rock formations, bird flocks and a host of natural wonders as you brave the Trisuli River! Suitable for beginners to intermediates Travel by public or private transport with your guides from / to Kathmandu Or enhance your private transfer from Kathmandu to Pokhara by adding a rafting venture Get briefed on river rafting and safety procedures by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Get briefed on river rafting and safety procedures by experienced guides, all of whom are certified instructors with rescue qualifications and first aid knowledge Glimpse scenic rock formations, bird flocks and a host of natural wonders as you brave the Trisuli River! Glimpse scenic rock formations, bird flocks and a host of natural wonders as you brave the Trisuli River! Suitable for beginners to intermediates Suitable for beginners to intermediates Travel by public or private transport with your guides from / to Kathmandu Travel by public or private transport with your guides from / to Kathmandu Or enhance your private transfer from Kathmandu to Pokhara by adding a rafting venture Or enhance your private transfer from Kathmandu to Pokhara by adding a rafting venture What We Love:   What We Love: Get a taste for the famed river rafting spot in Nepal: the Trisuli River. With origins in the Himalayas, snaking through to the nation's southern plains, the river is rife with scenic gorges, rock formations and local villages, as well as flocks of native and migrant birds. Savor a rush of adrenaline as you paddle through foamy white water and feel the power of the rapids, fascinatingly named: Ladies' Delight, Monsoon, Upset and Surprise! Those trying out whitewater rafting for the first time need not worry, as the Trisuli offers the perfect rapids for beginner to intermediate participants. It's also the better way to get from Kathmandu to Pokhara – instead of taking a flight or drive, why not enjoy an exhilarating waterborne journey from one city to the other?

Begin your Kathmandu travels hassle-free with this convenient airport-hotel transfer After customs clearance at the arrival hall, look out for your name on a signboard, held by a representative Enjoy a convenient transfer from the airport to your Kathmandu City hotel (Ring Road area) Take in first sights of Kathmandu City from the comfort of a car (2-3 pax), van (4-5 pax) or minibus (8-12 pax) After customs clearance at the arrival hall, look out for your name on a signboard, held by a representative After customs clearance at the arrival hall, look out for your name on a signboard, held by a representative Enjoy a convenient transfer from the airport to your Kathmandu City hotel (Ring Road area) Enjoy a convenient transfer from the airport to your Kathmandu City hotel (Ring Road area) Take in first sights of Kathmandu City from the comfort of a car (2-3 pax), van (4-5 pax) or minibus (8-12 pax) Take in first sights of Kathmandu City from the comfort of a car (2-3 pax), van (4-5 pax) or minibus (8-12 pax) What We Love:   What We Love: Spend the first 15 or so minutes of your travels in complete convenience with an airport-hotel transfer. Ride from Tribhuvan International Airport to Kathmandu's city center in no time, taking in sights from the comfort of a private car, van or bus – each accommodating (2-3), (4-7) and (8-12) passengers respectively. You may also opt for the roundtrip option and enjoy twice the convenience! With a hassle-free experience from the moment you land, these transfers set you up for the memorable journey ahead.

A scenic drive across the Himalayan landscape is ideal for travelers not pressed for time, letting you better explore Nepali terrain while in transit. Needless to say, it's a great way to optimize your stay!

Soar across one of the world's most incredible mountain ranges in this airborne Himalayan journey Soar amidst the magnificent wonders of the Everest region Fly a trusted airline for a memorable experience: Buddha Air, Yeti Air or Simrik Air (subject to scheduling availability) See the peak of Mt. Everest, the world's highest mountain Glimpse other Himalayan peaks, such as Kangchenjuna, Lhotse, the Annapurnas and many more Soar amidst the magnificent wonders of the Everest region Soar amidst the magnificent wonders of the Everest region Fly a trusted airline for a memorable experience: Buddha Air, Yeti Air or Simrik Air (subject to scheduling availability) Fly a trusted airline for a memorable experience: Buddha Air, Yeti Air or Simrik Air (subject to scheduling availability) See the peak of Mt. It's perfect for the majority of us who'll never make the arduous climb to the summit. The flight – aboard Buddha Air, Yeti Air or Simrik Air – covers the incredible mountain ranges, glaciers and gorges of the Himalayan region, so you can expect to spend an hour in awe over these striking sights. See the top Everest, the world's highest mountain, and spot as many as 16 neighboring peaks on your airborne adventure: Kangchenjunga, third in the world; Lhotse, following at fourth; Makalu, the Annapurnas, and many more.

Quickly transit between Kathmandu City and Pokhara by plane Swiftly journey from Kathmandu City to Pokhara (OR Pokhara to Kathmandu City) with this 25-minute flight aboard Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air or Yeti Airlines (subject to scheduling availability) Enjoy comfortable hotel-airport and airport-hotel transfers in both cities Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you fly high up in the air Swiftly journey from Kathmandu City to Pokhara (OR Pokhara to Kathmandu City) with this 25-minute flight aboard Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air or Yeti Airlines (subject to scheduling availability) Swiftly journey from Kathmandu City to Pokhara (OR Pokhara to Kathmandu City) with this 25-minute flight aboard Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air or Yeti Airlines (subject to scheduling availability) Enjoy comfortable hotel-airport and airport-hotel transfers in both cities Enjoy comfortable hotel-airport and airport-hotel transfers in both cities Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you fly high up in the air Glimpse the natural Nepali landscape as you fly high up in the air What We Love:   What We Love: Fly from Kathmandu City to Pokhara (or vice versa) with ease via leading local airlines - Simrik Airlines, Buddha Air, Yeti Airlines – and add some much-deserved convenience to your trip. Those with tighter itineraries will appreciate the swift transit of these one-way flights. Bringing both cities within easy access of the other, hopping aboard a plane is a great way to optimize your Nepal stay!

Spend a day getting to know Kathmandu Valley's ancient cities Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambhunath Stupa Explore Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in Nepal and holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet See open-air cremation sites at Pashupatinath, at Bagmati River (optional) Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Roam the UNESCO-listed Durbar Square, also known as Hanuman Dhoka Square Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambhunath Stupa Also see one of Nepal's oldest Buddhist temples, the Swayambhunath Stupa Explore Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in Nepal and holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet Explore Boudhanath Stupa, the largest stupa in Nepal and holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet See open-air cremation sites at Pashupatinath, at Bagmati River (optional) See open-air cremation sites at Pashupatinath, at Bagmati River (optional) What We Love:   What We Love: Spend a day exploring Kathmandu Valley's UNESCO-listed World Heritage Sites. Explore Durbar Square, the olden kingdom throne of Kathmandu's rulers, before visiting the most important Buddhist shrine in all of Nepal: Swayambhunath Stupa, also known as Monkey Temple. You'll also get to see Boudhanath, the largest stupa in Nepal and the holiest Tibetan Buddhist Temple outside Tibet. And for those who would like to delve deeper into local cultures, Pashupatinath is a not-to-be-missed as one of the most important Hindu Temples in Nepal, located near the Bagmati river. At the gates, plateaus are made that are used for the open air cremations that take place on a daily basis. You'll get better acquainted with the nation's rich heritage in this day trip, spanning the valley's ancient cities, as you wade through their numerous cultural and religious monuments.

Surrounding the area are beautiful views of the city, as well as sights of Phewa Lake nearby – where you'll head to next. Opt for a quiet boating trip on the water, before stopping by the Barahi Temple, located in the middle of the lake. With full- and half-day options, these easy sightseeing trips are welcome introductions to the rich city of Pokhara.

Birds of prey are known to have a natural instinct to conserve energy as they fly, drawing toward thermals – rising currents of warm air – in order to travel farther distances without flapping their wings. With a trained vulture as your airborne guide, you'll soar against the Himalaya, across the dense forest green, and experience feeding the winged creature as it lands on your hand for a snack. You'll also be treated to a session on vulture conservation and learn how parahawking has helped prevent Nepal's vultures from extinction. Offered exclusively by Blue Sky Paragliding, it's an incredible initiative that brings together adventure, eco-tourism and conservation in an exhilarating journey, with proceeds going directly to conservation projects. Plus, where else in the world will you get to paraglide with vultures?

What We Love:   What We Love: Tread the landmark Morne Brabant mountain on horseback and grace the monolithic peaks with renewed appreciation. Known as the refuge to runaway slaves in the 18th to early 19th centuries, Le Morne remains a powerful symbol of slave rights and freedom, suffering and sacrifice. Coupled with majestic sea views all around, including Benitier's Island to the north and Forneau Island to the south, you're sure to find yourself breathless with awe. You'll also get to dip in the cool waters of the beaches with your own mare, a beautiful, retired racehorse.

Think of it as riding your own Jet Ski, except with up to two people for company and the comfort of full, sit-back seating arrangements. Explore the sea foam-green lagoon of Benitier's Island, the emblematic Le Morne peninsula with its piercing mountaintop, and the tranquil seaside village of Flic en Flac. You'll get to ride in varying speeds as you cut through the water, and relish cool swimming breaks in between. It's the ultimate way to see one Mauritius landmark after another, while gracing both land and water of this oceanic gem.

Cover landmarks like Fort Adelaide, also known as La Citadelle, a national monument from where you could get sprawling views of the capital. Peruse local merchandise and get a taste for local shopping at the Central Market – also called Port Louis Bazaar – and the lively Caudan Waterfront, before heading north to Cap Malheureux, a fishing village punctuated by the photogenic, red-roofed Notre Dame Auxiliatrice. From here you'll be taken to Grand Baie Beach – the ‘Bay Without End' – and round off your trip at Super U, the largest supermarket on the island. If it sounds like a packed day, it sure is – one that leaves you a little more intimate with the island of paradise that is Mauritius!

What We Love:   What We Love: Dip into the waters of Mauritius and get a taste for the island's breathtaking landscape in this full-day tour. Immerse yourself in the habitat of the island's marine residents, with a two-hour swim with Bottlenose and Spinner Dolphins off the coast of Tamarin Bay. Then take in scenic views of distant mountains and endless horizons en route to Chamarel, where you'll happen upon a waterfall and the renowned Seven Coloured Earth – a beautiful, natural phenomena of sand dunes with traces of red, violet, purple, blue, green, yellow and brown – the result of decomposed volcanic gullies, whose hues reveal the presence of different minerals. Afterwards it's off to Casela Nature & Leisure Park, where you'll meet and greet Mauritian wildlife and enjoy the option to zipline, roam on a quadbike and walk with lions!

Hop aboard a speedboat to Ile aux Cerfs and enjoy a host of watersports against stunning natural backdrop on this private tour Sail through the skies with a parasailing trip (accommodates 2) Cut through the water with a tube ride (accommodates 2) Roam the Mauritian seabed with an undersea walk Wander the fine, sandy beaches and splendid blue waters of Ile aux Cerfs Island See the roaring Grand River South East Waterfalls Indulge in a hearty lunch at the private island, Îlot Mangénie Sail through the skies with a parasailing trip (accommodates 2) Sail through the skies with a parasailing trip (accommodates 2) Cut through the water with a tube ride (accommodates 2) Cut through the water with a tube ride (accommodates 2) Roam the Mauritian seabed with an undersea walk Roam the Mauritian seabed with an undersea walk Wander the fine, sandy beaches and splendid blue waters of Ile aux Cerfs Island Wander the fine, sandy beaches and splendid blue waters of Ile aux Cerfs Island See the roaring Grand River South East Waterfalls See the roaring Grand River South East Waterfalls Indulge in a hearty lunch at the private island, Îlot Mangénie Indulge in a hearty lunch at the private island, Îlot Mangénie What We Love:   What We Love: Off the east coast of Mauritius is a strip of heaven on earth baptized ‘Ile aux Cerfs'. ‘Deer Island' in English and once home to Java-imported cerf, Ile aux Cerfs no longer hosts the creatures of the hunt, and instead offers locals and visitors some of the most stunning white beaches and turquoise waters. Spend a day at this island paradise and the ocean surrounding it with your own private tour, featuring exhilarating activities such as parasailing and tube riding. Roam the ocean bed with an undersea walk, snorkel around captivating lagoons, and then drop by the Grand River Waterfalls. Inclusive of a barbecue lunch on the neighboring private island, Îlot Mangénie, this package promises to deliver a full day of sun kissed memories, and genuine splashes of wonder.

Love: Well known for its golds and blues, the island paradise of Mauritius is also home to darker, earthier hues – as revealed in this tour of the south. See Trou aux Cerfs, a dormant volcano some 600m in elevation, before stopping at Historic Marine, the largest model ship factory in Mauritius. Then troop over to Grand Bassin, a crater lake that is also a sacred pilgrimage site for Hindus, and its surrounding shrines and temples – including the highest statue in Mauritius, the 33m-tall Shiva. A contrast from sibling emerald beaches, the southern tip of Gris Gris awaits next, with its fierce waves and charcoal cliffs, as well as the wave-chiseled Pont Naturel. The earthen palette lasts here, with a last stop at Blue Bay bringing back sights of turquoise waters and coral reefs, inviting many a visitor to a refreshing snorkel.

The luxury cruise begins with a sail out to Tamarin Bay, where you'll encounter dolphins and get the chance to join them in the water. Go for a hearty swim with these friendly creatures, before cruising further along to La Preneuse. With snorkeling stops all throughout, you'll get to experience more of Mauritius' underwater beauty, swimming amongst colorful fish and mesmerizing coral. The trip comes with a freshly prepared lunch on the catamaran, and a full boat crew to deliver no less than a memorable trip – capped off with a visit to Le Morne Crystal Rock, pristinely set in the middle of the ocean, and blessed with enthralling views of Rempart Mountain and Black River along the way.

See the beauty of Mauritius as you sail across crystal blue water, amidst breathtaking landscapes, while jovial crew ensure you a well-serviced trip. You'll sail to the Grand River Southeast, where a speedboat will take you up close to the waterfalls, before snorkeling in the company of colorful coral and fish, residents of emerald lagoons. A full barbecue lunch buffet then awaits, filling you with generous servings of fresh fish and chicken, salads and fruits, readying you for the journey toward Ile aux Cerfs island. It's a sun kissed paradise of white sand beaches and inviting palm trees – the perfect last leg, in what we reckon is the best way to spend a day in Mauritius.
